thread.title: Sideline: UCA soccer honors and CCS volleyball
thread.title_full: Sideline: UCA soccer honors and CCS volleyball

author: Staff
title: Sideline: UCA soccer honors and CCS volleyball
text:
Sideline: UCA soccer honors and CCS volleyball Posted: October 13, 2015 - 8:33pm 2 UCA players receive soccer honors 
For the second time this season, University of Central Arkansas Bears took home two of the three Player of the Week awards in the Southland Conference. 
Stacia Carroll was named the league’s Defensive Player of the Week and Anna Hughes earned Goalkeeper of the Week honors. 
Carroll played a big part in helping Central Arkansas earn its first point against four-time defending SLC regular season champion Stephen F. Austin since 2010. The South Jordan, Utah, native was on the field for all 110 minutes of the 1-1 draw. SFA is averaging 1.67 goals game in SLC play. Carroll also netted the Bears’ only goal on the night, tying the match at 1-1 in the 88th minute. The sophomore launched the ball from midfield and into the back of the net for her first goal of the season. 
Hughes had a career match against the Ladyjacks, making a career-high 13 saves while facing 30 shots. She made a pair of saves in the first half, before adding seven more to her total in the second half and another in the first overtime period. She came on especially strong in the second overtime period, making a pair of diving stops to preserve the draw. 
The Bears play the final two home matches of the season this weekend. Central Arkansas will host Houston Baptist on Friday night at the Bill Stephens Complex. The night will serve as Senior Night for the Bears, who will honor the careers of senior Megan Thomas and junior Kate Koch, who will be graduating early. 
On Sunday, Central Arkansas will welcome Texas A&M-Corpus Christi for a match at 1 p.m. CCS win twice in volleyball 
Conway Christian defeated Harding Academy, 25-20, 25-19, 23-25, 25-22 in volleyball Monday. 
Thursday, the Lady Eagles downed Mayflower, 19-25, 25-14, 21-25, 25-10, 15-8.
